Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Do not redirect `https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json` to `https://nuget.cdn.azure.cn/v3/index.json`" (#8468) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### For issues connecting to NuGet.org, please refer to [this guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/faqs/nuget-faq#nugetorg-not-accessible).

### For issues regarding your NuGet.org account, please refer to [this guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/faqs/nuget-faq#nugetorg-account-management).

### Describe the bug
Cannot access `https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json`, because you automatically redirect it to `https://nuget.cdn.azure.cn/v3/index.json`.

And `https://nuget.cdn.azure.cn` has been down for a while.

### To Reproduce
```
C:\Users\blued> aria2c  https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

03/27 10:29:19 [NOTICE] Downloading 1 item(s)

03/27 10:29:20 [NOTICE] CUID#7 - Redirecting to https://nuget.cdn.azure.cn/v3/index.json
[#47c20f 0B/0B CN:1 DL:0B]
03/27 10:29:41 [NOTICE] CUID#7 - Redirecting to https://nuget.cdn.azure.cn/v3/index.json
[#47c20f 0B/0B CN:1 DL:0B]
03/27 10:30:03 [NOTICE] CUID#7 - Redirecting to https://nuget.cdn.azure.cn/v3/index.json
[#47c20f 0B/0B CN:1 DL:0B]
03/27 10:30:10 [NOTICE] Shutdown sequence commencing... Press Ctrl-C again for emergency shutdown.

03/27 10:30:10 [NOTICE] Download GID#47c20fcf7b87320b not complete:

Download Results:
gid   |stat|avg speed  |path/URI
======+====+===========+=======================================================
47c20f|INPR|       0B/s|https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

Status Legend:
(INPR):download in-progress.

aria2 will resume download if the transfer is restarted.
If there are any errors, then see the log file. See '-l' option in help/man page for details.
C:\Users\blued>
```

### Expected behavior
Do not redirect `https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json` to `https://nuget.cdn.azure.cn/v3/index.json`.
Or fix `nuget.cdn.azure.cn`.

### Screenshots

https://www.isitdownrightnow.com/nuget.cdn.azure.cn.html

![ÁÅ´ÁãêÊà™Âõæ_2021-03-27T02-40-31 709Z](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/398352/112707799-f0e49080-8ee8-11eb-984b-b7ad0d3339ae.png)


### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Readme show" (#8467) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters): showmore will display when readme length > 500 ![NuGet Gallery _ embeddedReadmeTestApp 6 1 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/112684204-e914e580-8e2f-11eb-84b6-7dac44a2c371.gif) if readme length is less than 500 Let me know if you think 5 lines work better, if so, we need count the number of newline in the readme html before actually display, seemly like not ideal Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3710 https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8458 https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8461

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Embedded Icons cause Access Denied from source "Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages" on Browse tab" (#10687) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): VS

Product version: 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

It appears that when a fallback folder is utilized by PM UI to retrieve a Package Icon, we unnecessarily require a Write permission which icon files do not grant to VS. The result is when using Browse Tab, if a package exists in the fallback folder with an icon, that icon will not load. 
The Installed tab does not have this problem, my guess is because is pulled from the global packages folder instead.

Exception occurs at: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio/Services/NuGetPackageFileService.cs#L150

Stack begins from ViewModel requesting icon here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/ViewModels/PackageItemViewModel.cs#L539

## Repro steps and/or sample project

<!-- Please add as much details as possible to help us to reproduce your problem. -->
1. Install a package with an embedded icon (ex: coverlet.collector\1.3.0)
2. Open PM UI to the Browse tab. Set the Package Source dropdown to "Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages".
3. (optional) close PM UI and reopen it to avoid any cached state from previous step.
4. Observe that the package's icon is the default icon.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/112365258-d377b280-8cad-11eb-8e04-c8a744dd7b9a.png)


### Verbose Logs

<!-- Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGetVersionRange allows logically incorrect ranges to be parsed" (#9145) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
See: https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/5.5.0-preview.2.6382/parse-version-range?versionRange=%5B10.0.0%2C+9.0.0%29

> [10.0.0, 9.0.0)

This range is empty and there's no reasonable scenario where it's necessary. 

This has always been the case, all the way to 2.5 https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/2.5.0/parse-version-range?versionRange=%5B10.0.0%2C+9.0.0%29.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VS Solution manager throws null exception for during debugging" (#10352) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I recently noticed there is null exception kept throwing when try to open PMUI/PMC. 
It looks due to recent effort to move from synchronous code to async ones causing this timing issue. It doesn't guarantee `init` is done before code start is using supposedly already initialized things.
Also jebriede [reported it](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:00d019d741b44e54baadd67ef7aeb41d@thread.skype/1606247461775?tenantId=72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db47&groupId=ad34ac55-6785-4e7c-82c3-7ba405d30c3c&parentMessageId=1606247461775&teamName=NuGet&channelName=Client&createdTime=1606247461775) same problem recently.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/100144755-1898ee80-2e4c-11eb-9fba-c4e64fe331ab.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove unreachable code calling EventTrigger.dll" (#10584) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: NuGet 2.xx

## Repro steps and/or sample project

I found dead code "EventTrigger.dll" from NuGet 2.xx era.
It was introduced [here](https://github.com/anurse/NuGet/commit/9d172f2db54ea6efb807e56693e4bbeaf53942e0).
Now it's time to remove NuGetEventTrigger.cs, TriggerEventMethod.cs which are related to "EventTrigger.dll", because it's taxing on performance.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGetSdkResolver's test project and folder names mismatch" (#10513) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The project and folder names for the `NuGetSdkResolver`'s are not the same. The folder name ends with `Tests` while the project name ends with `Test`. Both names should be same as with the rest of the test projects' naming style.

So, should we rename folder to match the project or vice-versa?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "GetReferenceNearestTargetFrameworkTask should not log params when LogTaskInputs is set" (#10696) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When MSBuild sets LogTaskInputs, there's no need to specifically log task inputs or outputs as MSBuild will take care of that.

See here:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/58fd22bfc941a6d5cc9404f41a583efb4dfeeaf0/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/GetReferenceNearestTargetFrameworkTask.cs#L64

See https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/issues/6305 for guidance. Otherwise there's duplication, allocations, log bloat:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/679326/112683759-4e1c0b80-8e2f-11eb-8802-27d71ff218bb.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove the "v" from the version number in PMUI" (#10677) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet restore failing on .NET 5 for Archlinux" (#10695) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
disclaimer: seems related to *NuGet restore failing on .NET 5 for Debian-based OSes (CA trust changed)* aka #10491 

## Details about Problem
Using the archlinux package: `community/dotnet-sdk 5.0.4.sdk104-1` (47.3 MiB 165.6 MiB)

## Repro steps and/or sample project
Here a simple exe to create snk key (since this tools is still not available on MacOS and Linux dotnet cli)
```sh
$ cd ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey
$ cat CreateSigningKey.csproj
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>netcoreapp2.1</TargetFramework>
    <!-- see https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/12237 -->
    <RollForward>LatestMajor</RollForward>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```
src: https://github.com/google/or-tools/blob/stable/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj

### Verbose Logs
When trying to restore
```sh
$ dotnet restore
  Determining projects to restore...
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref 3.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.1.10' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3037: Package 'Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref 3.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3037: Package 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.1.10' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref 3.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository countersignature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.1.10' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository countersignature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
```

FYI 
```sh
$ dotnet --info
.NET SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   5.0.104
 Commit:    ca6b6acadb

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     arch
 OS Version:  
 OS Platform: Linux
 RID:         arch-x64
 Base Path:   /usr/share/dotnet/sdk/5.0.104/

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 5.0.4
  Commit:  269e323b5f

.NET SDKs installed:
  5.0.104 [/usr/share/dotnet/sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 5.0.4 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App]

To install additional .NET runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Package Namespaces Proposal" (#55) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Introduction of a feature concept called Package Namespaces which allows a developer to include or exclude package IDs by specifying package namespaces on their package source(s).

üéâüì¶Please provide your comments, concerns, and feedback within this PR. üì¶üéâ

https://github.com/NuGet/Home/pull/10660

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Custom V2 OData queries will be deprecated March 9th, 2021 " (#54) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (#37) last year and conducted a dry run of the deprecation to ensure that there are no surprises for users (#40). 

We will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in March 9, 2021, as detailed in [the blogpost here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/custom-v2-odata-queries-will-be-deprecated-march-9-2021/).

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post.](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/
